# Tender Announcement: Architectural Services for NCC Workplace Modernization - Lisgar Road Offices

## Background
The National Capital Commission (NCC) invites qualified architectural firms to participate in the procurement process for the provision of architectural services for the NCC Workplace Modernization project at the Lisgar Road Offices.

## Intent
The Commission intends to retain the services of a registered architectural professional to provide expertise for the rehabilitation and interior fit-up of two existing buildings. The services will involve designing and specifying sustainable and accessible workplace solutions for the new office space, ensuring alignment with current standards.

## Basis of Selection
The contract award will be based on a combined rating of technical merit and price.

## Tender Process
The procurement process is subject to trade agreements including the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). 

## Site Visit
A mandatory site visit will be held on November 15, 2023, at 3:30 pm (EST). For more details, refer to the procurement documents.

## Tender Documents
All tender documents, including the tender notice, addenda, and specification documents, are available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service website, [Tender opportunities | CanadaBuys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/occasions-demarche).

## Contact Information
For any inquiry, please submit your questions in writing by email to Sr. Contract Officer, Emilie Scheckman (emilie.scheckman@ncc-ccn.ca) as early as possible within the solicitation period. 

## Tender Submission
Please submit your tender proposal to the National Capital Commission by email at Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca, referencing the tender file number, ES038.

## Important Dates
* Tender Notice Release Date: October 27, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: December 11, 2023, at 3:00 pm (EST)
* Contract Start Date: January 8, 2024
* Contract End Date: November 30, 2027

## Notice
The procurement process is subject to changes, and it is the bidder’s responsibility to stay informed about changes to the tender documents through the CanadaBuy website.
